title: Watchdog under pressure to reform supervision after Woodford
text:
Pressure is building on the City watchdog to overhaul the relationships between fund managers and those meant to supervise them, following the implosion of Neil Woodford’s investment empire.

Conservative MP Kevin Hollinrake said the collapse of Mr Woodford’s flagship fund showed that his supervisor Link Fund Solutions offered “little more than a false sense of security” to investors. Mr Woodford’s failure has also stoked concerns about potential conflicts of interest, because supervisors are appointed and paid by the fund managers they oversee.

Alan Miller, of wealth manager SCM Direct, said it was “shocking” that Link had failed to curb Mr Woodford’s enthusiasm for investing in unlisted assets....
